text: Charles Grey, 2nd Earl Grey, KG, PC (13 March 1764 – 17 July 1845) was a British Whig statesman and Prime Minister. Earl Grey tea, a type of tea with a bergamot orange flavour is named after him. He was the son of Major General Charles Grey, 1st Earl Grey. == Titles == * Charles Grey (1764 - 1806) * Viscount Howick (1806 - 1807) * 2nd Earl Grey (1807 - 1845) == References == Category:1764 births Category:1845 deaths Category:United Kingdom Earls Category:People from Northumberland Category:UK MPs 1801–1802 Category:UK MPs 1802–1806 Category:UK MPs 1806–1807 Category:UK MPs 1807–1812 Category:Whig party (UK) politicians
title: Charles Grey, 2nd Earl Grey
